reviewText: amazing, one worth watching it again.
A great film and excellent script.
Gorgeous night time and daylight cinematography. Great storytelling. Long film that rewards your patience. Immaculate restoration. One of the greatest films of Taiwanese cinema.
One of Edward Yang's masterpiece. Possibly the best one. This movie is a must see.

the only pity is no movie poster in it.

masterpriece

25 years ago, I was 15 (as the same age of Si'r). I went to see this movie in a brighter summer day. Since then, I became a fan of Edward Yang. 25 years later, thanks for Criterion Collection's terrific restoration, I can watch it on my TV, with the best quality that beyond my expectation. With this edition, I have found many details that I've never noticed before on the silver screen, not to mention the poor VCD edition.

Thank Edward Yang for creating this fantastic film, and thank Criterion Collection for reviving it again.
Outstanding film, outstanding restoration. A worthy tribute to Edward Yang from the Criterion Collection.
Just did not get it.  A boring film of the young and bored.  Did not, could not, would not get to the end.

You can watch this as a youth gang movie. You can also read more into Taiwanese period. But I think there's always something universal no matter where you are, looking for something youthful - rosy, hopeful, and always bright summer day.
Dreams of love and hope shall never die

Growing up in Taipei during the 60s.
The formation of street gangs and the violence it brings along.
The story has a tragic ending and it is very well presented.
This film is very different from YiYi.
A cinema classic. Well worth your time watching a master director do his best work.
A great visual journey into the dreams and aspirations of world and thing that we sometimes over look.
Window into a time and place.
A great film for those with patience and intelligence.
